dt: {bc}either of the pair of openings of the nose or nasal cavity

pt: The spelling {it}naris{/it} is the more usual singular form of this noun. The singular spelling variant {it}nare{/it} is a {d_link|back-formation|back-formation} from the plural form {it}nares{/it}. As such, {it}nare{/it} is often criticized, but it does appear occasionally in published, edited medical sources.

et: borrowed from Latin {it}nāris{/it}, plural {it}nārēs{/it} "nostril"; akin to Latin {it}nāsus{/it} "nose" {ma}{mat|nose:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: either of the pair of openings of the nose or nasal cavity
